channel.title: Color Help
channel.description:
const barC= 1576968;//Color of bar
Procedure heal; begin if(ColorT = 1576968)then SendKeys(F1); repeat;
Hi, I really am a noob and need help. I want to make it look for color black at these coordinates (136, 144) and if it is black I want it to push F1. I am not sure if I should use getcolor and I keep getting errors with it. Can anyone help me please? Thanks
Edit: Sorry this belongs in the other help I guess.

item.title: Color Help
item.dc:creator: @junkant junkant
item.description:
@junkant wrote:

Thanks Sonny and Nashi again,
I am going to have to stick to color search and it works good enough.
Got a few questions that I am wondering about scar.
Is it possible to compile SCAR into a trainer type program?
Also is it possible to use code from the game with SCAR script?
What I mean is if I search for the code of health with Cheat Engine or Tsearch, will I be able to use it in scar. EX: If code < 90 push F1.
Thanks guys.

Read full topic

item.title: Color Help
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Yup xD
And for finding moving objects or even most things on the main screen, Since it can be viewed at different angles, I wouldn’t suggest a bitmap or DTM.
Mainly because at a different viewpoint it wouldn’t work
Unless you tried FindBitmapDeformed or something, Maybe even just very high tolerance xD

Your best bet would be colour

Read full topic

item.title: Color Help
item.dc:creator: @junkant junkant
item.description:
@junkant wrote:

Thanks guys, I am learning a lot and having fun.
I also made my own. Can you tell me if it is good at all for a first try?

Procedure heal;
begin
if(GetColor(185, 143) = 1576968)then
SendKeysVb(’{F1}’,false)
end;

Also I would like to make a clicker that clicks with 2 keys like this [SHIFT] + Left Click.
It would hold shift and click at the same time.
It would work with the keydown command right?
And can someone show me a link or post a file with what keys = what?
Thanks again

Procedure kill2;

begin
if(FindColorSpiral(xx, yy, monster2, 256, 150, 768, 617))then
KeyDown(VK_SHIFT)
ClickMouse(xx, yy, True);
Wait(800)
KeyUp(VK_SHIFT)
wait(500+random(500));

My Try, it works is there anything that I should improve. Going to try to use bitmaps next.

Edit: just finished reading what Nashi said, I guess I was on the right path.

Read full topic

item.title: Color Help
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

[code]program new;
var
x, y:Integer;

Procedure Heal;
begin
If FindColor(x, y, 0, 134, 142, 137, 146) then
begin
KeyDown(VK_F1)
Wait(20)
KeyUp(VK_F1)
end;
end;
begin
Meal;
end.[/code]

Close Razor, Your definately getting there, You’ve got most of it right, However the If part is wrong.
If works like,
If (Condition) then
If the condition is true then it will do the next 1 command after the then.
If you put false in there then the condition is false and it not do the command afterwards
If you put true like you had then it will always do the next command.
Also, If’s and thens and basically all loops except repeat only do the next command.
That’s why to group single commands into one you use begin and end; like I did up there, If you look by the indenting youll know where.

It’s the same as putting it into a procedure called PressF1 and just having PressF1; after the then.
Other wise it will only push F1 down in the if statement
and wait 20 ms then simulate releasing the f1 key anyway because of the grouping error with begin and end;

If you still have questions then reply

Note this is presuming you wanted to only press it down in the if statement

Oh and to check the colour at 136 144 do if (GetColour(136, 144) == 0) then.

xDD exps I saw you add the begin and end
You beated me to replying >_<

Read full topic

item.title: Color Help
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

You’re a bit off…

[code]program new;
var
x, y:Integer;

Procedure Heal;
begin
If (FindColor(x, y, 0, 134, 142, 137, 146)) then
begin;
KeyDown(112)
Wait(20)
KeyUp(112)
end;
end;
begin
repeat
heal;
until(isFkeydown(11));
end.[/code]

I just fixed Razorlike’s script.
Its pretty lame, but it does exactly what you want (assuming everything you told us was accurate).

Read full topic

item.title: Color Help
item.dc:creator: @Razorlike Razorlike
item.description:
@Razorlike wrote:

[code]program new;
var
x, y:Integer;

Procedure Heal;
begin
FindColor(x, y, 0, 134, 142, 137, 146)
If(true)then
KeyDown(VK_F1)
Wait(20)
KeyUp(VK_F1)
end;
begin
end.[/code]

I’m also very new at codes (started yesterday :p)
This little script will look for the color 0 (black) in a box. If it finds the color it presses F1.
